citeinfo.origin: California Department of Fish and Game, Marine Region GIS Lab
citeinfo.title: California Marine Protected Areas

descript.abstract: These data include all of California's marine protected areas (MPAs) with associated Department of Fish and Game (DFG) fishing regulations as of May 2007 and updated central coast Marine Life Protection Act MPAs recently adopted by the California Fish and Game Commission (FGC) on April 13, 2007 (in effect September 21, 2007). This dataset reflects Department of Fish and Game's best representation of marine protected areas based upon 2007 California Fish and Game Code book and State of California Fish and Game Commission California Code of Regulations, Title 14: Natural Resources, Division 1: FGC- DFG. This dataset is not intended for navigational use or defining legal boundaries. This multiple polygon vector shapefile dataset includes all marine protected areas (with associated fishing regulations) for California's coastline and islands.
descript.purpose: These boundaries were developed using the legal definitions of California marine protected areas found in Title 14, California Code of Regulations, Section 632(b) as of September 2007. The boundaries described are solely intended as a visual representation of the areas included and do not replace or supercede the legal definitions.
descript.supplinf:
Updates for May 2007: MPAs adopted in the Central Coast Study Region, through the Marine Life Protection Act process, replaced all previous MPA boundaries in that extext. Begin source metadata abstract*****
On April 13, 2007 the California Fish and Game Commission (Commission) adopted regulations for new marine protected areas (MPAs) in central California (Pigeon Pt., San Mateo County, to Point Conception, Santa Barbara County). This formal adoption represents the culmination of a comprehensive public involvement process to begin implementation of the Marine Life Protection Act (MLPA). The process included the work of a Blue Ribbon Task Force (Task Force) convened by the Secretary for Resources, the work and discussions of a comprehensive constituent panel, a scientific advisory panel and others. The process also included multiple public input opportunities in a variety of venues.
In April 2006 the Task Force formally transmitted three alternative MPA packages (Identified as Packages 1, 2R, and 3R) to the Department of Fish and Game (Department) for its consideration. The Task Force recommended that one package (Package 3R) be considered the preferred alternative. In developing the Department's preferred alternative (Package P), the Department considered the input received from the Blue Ribbon Task Force and other groups along with the extensive public comment and input received during this and previous MLPA implementation efforts. Additionally, the Department conducted a series of face-to-face and teleconference meetings with a broad range of constituents to discuss their specific concerns about the Department's draft proposal. All of this input helped the Department make critical decisions regarding the formation of a preferred alternative. The Commission reviewed the Department and Task Force recommendations, heard additional public comment and developed their own preferred alternative. This alternative was eventually adopted as the regulations for the central coast.
End source metadata abstract*****
Shapes generated by waypoints submitted in legislative process.
Updates for December 2005: Updates based upon adopted Commission ammendments to Section 632 on August 19, 2005. State of California Fish and Game Commission California Code of Regulations, Title 14. Summarized changes include: 1) Designation changes for six areas from SMP to SMCA: Robert E. Badham, Irvine Coast, Laguna Beach, South Laguna Beach, Niguel, and Doheny. 2) Name and designation change: Doheny SMP to Doheny Beach SMCA 3) Special closure regulations for San Miguel and Anacapa Islands
San Miguel Special Closure: Section 632(b)(43)(A) created upon coordinates and converted to decimal degrees. Added coordinates of rocks (Judith, Castle) into project as xy coordinates then converted into polyine from points using XToolsPro. Made new polygon using polyline feature. Buffered coastline (Coastn83 file) to 300 yards of specified area (western end of island- west line drawn between the 2 rock points) using Buffer Wizard. Clipped 300 yard buffer zone to western area of island.
Anacapa Special Closures: Section 632(b)(52)(A) feature created off 20 foot (6m) depth contour line around Anacapa Island. Area made by selecting contour line, exporting line, and forcing line closure (tolerance = 0.20) in conversion of polyline to polygon.
Section 632(b)(52)(B) created upon reference coordinates points (Portuguese Rock, Frenchy's Cove) converted to decimal degrees and added as xy coordinates into project to be used as edge reference points. Then a new polygon feature was made using the 20 fathom line (120 feet) depth contour by converting polyline to polygon feature.
********************************************************************************** Original metadata follows:
This data set was made from the most accurate information available. Per section 632 (b), Title 14, CCR, all geographic coordinates listed use North American Datum 1983 reference datum. All measures were taken to document processes for future data replication (as follows): 1. MPA's based upon coordinates as prepared for DFG Commission, for adoption into Title 14. 2. Converted lat/long coordinates into decimal degrees using excel conversion table made especially for this process in MS Excel spreadsheet. 3. Spreadsheet saved as dbf4, csv files. 4. In ArcMap GIS project added the xy data using the tools feature using WGS1984. 5. Selected all entries related to each specific MPA area to make individual point shapefile in WGS1984. 6. Using GEO-tools made a polygon based upon invididual MPA point shapefile, using the convert tab. Converted multipoint file to polygon. Used sequence coding for file. (note-if message "The coordinate system of the Data Frame has geographic system that differs from one or more data sets in the Map! Correct the problem and try again" remove any layers that are in a different coordinate system than the layer trying to convert. ) 7. Buffer files created in NAD83 for the following offshore distances (in feet): 20, 150, 200, 300, 600, 1000, 1200, 1500, and 3000. Buffered from "county24k" DFG file. File can be downloaded via DFG ftp site: http://ftp.dfg.ca.gov/Public/Marine/ 8. Reprojected the individual files as a batch using ArcToolbox reprojection tool. Reprojected from WGS1984 to NAD83. 9. Buffers (NAD83) used to clip offshore or inshore boundaries, or fathom lines as references. 10. The following fathom lines were used in creating offshore boundaries for specified MPAs (depths in fathoms): 1.5, 3, 10, 20, 30, and 50. (Offshore depth boundaries based upon legal descriptions for Elkhorn Slough, Mackerricher, Sonoma, Russian Gulch, Van Damme, Fort Ross, Hopkins, Pacific Grove, Vandenberg, Crystal Cove, and Big Creek) 11. Digitized offshore/inshore boundary at 1: 10,000 scale. Note if the inshore boundary was onshore/coastline, then individual MPA was clipped to "county24k" (NAD83) layer, then manually adjusted (if needed) to NOAA chart at 1:10,000 scale (this was needed in areas of non-alignment and to compensate for the mean high tide line on NOAA charts). Reference chart used was NOAA nautical charts as follows per individual MPA: Punta Gorda- [18623_1], Mackerricher- [18626_1], 12. If offshore boundary was indeterminable using NOAA charts, then DFG DRG charts or aerial imagery (see step 13) were used. California DRG 1:24,000 scale digital charts were used as a reference for boundary mapping for the following individual MPAs: Sonoma Coast SMCA- [CALQUAD: 1099, QUADNAME: Bodega Head, OCODE: o38123c1, TRIM:8] [CALQUAD: 1062, QUADNAME: Duncan Mills, OCODE: o38123d1, TRIM:8] Fort Ross SMCA- [CALQUAD: 1026, QUADNAME: Fort Ross, OCODE: o38123e2, TRIM:8] [CALQUAD: 1025, QUADNAME: Plantation, OCODE: o38123e3, TRIM:8] Hopkins SMR- [CALQUAD: 1686, QUADNAME: Monterey, OCODE: o36121e8, TRIM:27] Agua Hedionda Lagoon SMR- [CALQUAD: 2947, QUADNAME: San Luis Rey, OCODE: o33117b3, TRIM:66] 13. Digitized inshore boundary at 1: 5,000 scale using the Coastal Commissions aerial imagery (NAD83) and/or downloadable imagery server GlobeXplorer (which hosts imagery from other sources: Airphoto USA, i-cubed, etc). The following aerial imagery was used as a reference boundary for the following individual MPA areas: Fort Ross- [fortross_sw.img] Manchester- [Geographic Data Technology, 1998-09-11, 1.0m resolution, 1:12,000 spatial accuracy, panchromatic] Del Mar-[GlobeXplorer, 2001-06-17, 0.1524m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Gerstle Cove- [GlobeXplorer, 2001-06-17, 0.154 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] San Dieguito - [Airphoto USA, 2003-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Corte Madera- [Airphoto USA, 2002-08-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Marin Islands- [Airphoto USA, 2002-08-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Robert W. Crown- [GlobeXplorer, 2000-06-25, 0.1524 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Redwood Shores and Bair Island-[i-cubed, 1999-10-05, 15.0 m resolution, 1:100,000 spatial accuracy, color] Goleta Slough- [Airphoto USA, 2000-05-01, 1.0 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Bolsa Chica- [Airphoto USA, 2004-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color, scale used: 1:20,000, 1:2,500, 1:500] Elkhorn Slough- [Airphoto USA, 2002-08-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Big Sycamore- [Airphoto USA, 2003-09-01, 0.3048 m resolution, 1:2000 spatial accuracy, color] Doheny SMCA/SMP- [Airphoto USA, 2004-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Upper Newport Bay- [Airphoto USA, 2004-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] San Elijo Lagoon- [Airphoto USA, 2003-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Buena Vista- [Airphoto USA, 2003-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] 14. Shoreline length was calculated using ET Geowizards. Shoreline in nautical miles. Converted MPA polygon layer into polyline layer. Split polyline into segments. Method used was selecting at all vertices. Each MPA was selected out that intersected with the shoreline layer "county24k". This layer was used as a proxy to get all shoreline portions only; therefore, offshore boundary lines excluded. Summarized all shoreline segments by MPA ID using Geowizards merge function, then summarize by ID. Total length of MPA that touches shoreline represented in field "Length_nmi". [Note- All offshore rocks excluded from selection. All shoreline of islands included. Estuarine MPAs value for length do not include the mouth of the estuary (if mouth occurs). All MPAs that do not touch land show value of zero for shoreline length. MPAs on islands includes shoreline of land for each island. (Farallon MPA includes: Maintop Is, Is of St. James, Southeast Is, and North Island only.) ] 15. Area calculated in square nautical miles. Field "Area_nmi" depicts area calculated for each MPA. Area calculated using X tools Pro, calculate area, nautical miles selected as unit of measure. 16. Perimeter calculated in nautical miles. Field "Perimeter_" depicts calculated perimeter of each MPA. Perimeter calculated using X tools Pro, calculate perimeter, nautical miles selected as unit of measure.

cntinfo.cntinst: Please send a request to mr_gis@dfg.ca.gov for assistance.

idinfo.datacred: State of California Department of Fish and Game, Marine Region GIS Lab
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420

pubinfo.pubplace: California Department of Fish and Game

attracc.attraccr: This data set was made from the most accurate information available. This dataset has been visually checked using various GIS software platforms. Georeferenced NOAA ENC (electronic navigational charts) were used to verify data alignment with California's coastline in addition to other sources such as, aerial photography and CDFG DRG 1:24,000 charts.

dataqual.complete: This data set was made from the most accurate information available. This dataset has been visually checked using various GIS software platforms. Georeferenced NOAA ENC (electronic navigational charts) were used to verify data alignment with California's coastline in addition to other sources such as, aerial photography (provided by GlobeXplorer and CA Coastal Commission) and CDFG DRG 1:24,000 charts.

srcinfo.srccontr: This file was made with California Department of Fish and Game Marine Region GIS data.

procstep.procdesc:
Updates for December 2005: Updates based upon adopted Commission ammendments to Section 632 on August 19, 2005. State of California Fish and Game Commission California Code of Regulations, Title 14. Summarized changes include: 1) Designation changes for six areas from SMP to SMCA: Robert E. Badham, Irvine Coast, Laguna Beach, South Laguna Beach, Niguel, and Doheny. 2) Name and designation change: Doheny SMP to Doheny Beach SMCA 3) Special closure regulations for San Miguel and Anacapa IslandsSan Miguel Special Closure: Section 632(b)(43)(A) created upon coordinates and converted to decimal degrees. Added coordinates of rocks (Judith, Castle) into project as xy coordinates then converted into polyine from points using XToolsPro. Made new polygon using polyline feature. Buffered coastline (Coastn83 file) to 300 yards of specified area (western end of island- west line drawn between the 2 rock points) using Buffer Wizard. Clipped 300 yard buffer zone to western area of island.
Anacapa Special Closures: Section 632(b)(52)(A) feature created off 20 foot (6m) depth contour line around Anacapa Island. Area made by selecting contour line, exporting line, and forcing line closure (tolerance = 0.20) in conversion of polyline to polygon.
Section 632(b)(52)(B) created upon reference coordinates points (Portuguese Rock, Frenchy's Cove) converted to decimal degrees and added as xy coordinates into project to be used as edge reference points. Then a new polygon feature was made using the 20 fathom line (120 feet) depth contour by converting polyline to polygon feature. ********************************************************************************** Original metadata follows:
All measures were taken to document processes for future data replication (as follows): 1. MPA's based upon coordinates as prepared for DFG Commission, for adoption into Title 14. 2. Converted lat/long coordinates into decimal degrees using excel conversion table made especially for this process in MS Excel spreadsheet. 3. Spreadsheet saved as dbf4, csv files. 4. In ArcMap GIS project added the xy data using the tools feature using WGS1984. 5. Selected all entries related to each specific MPA area to make individual point shapefile in WGS1984. 6. Using GEO-tools made a polygon based upon invididual MPA point shapefile, using the convert tab. Converted multipoint file to polygon. Used sequence coding for file. (note-if message "The coordinate system of the Data Frame has geographic system that differs from one or more data sets in the Map! Correct the problem and try again" remove any layers that are in a different coordinate system than the layer trying to convert. ) 7. Buffer files created in NAD83 for the following offshore distances (in feet): 20, 150, 200, 300, 600, 1000, 1200, 1500, and 3000. Buffered from "county24k" DFG file. File can be downloaded via DFG ftp site: http://ftp.dfg.ca.gov/Public/Marine/ 8. Reprojected the individual files as a batch using ArcToolbox reprojection tool. Reprojected from WGS1984 to NAD83. 9. Buffers (NAD83) used to clip offshore or inshore boundaries, or fathom lines as references. 10. The following fathom lines were used in creating offshore boundaries for specified MPAs (depths in fathoms): 1.5, 3, 10, 20, 30, and 50. (Offshore depth boundaries based upon legal descriptions for Elkhorn Slough, Mackerricher, Sonoma, Russian Gulch, Van Damme, Fort Ross, Hopkins, Pacific Grove, Vandenberg, Crystal Cove, and Big Creek) 11. Digitized offshore/inshore boundary at 1: 10,000 scale. Note if the inshore boundary was onshore/coastline, then individual MPA was clipped to "county24k" (NAD83) layer, then manually adjusted (if needed) to NOAA chart at 1:10,000 scale (this was needed in areas of non-alignment and to compensate for the mean high tide line on NOAA charts). Reference chart used was NOAA nautical charts as follows per individual MPA: Punta Gorda- [18623_1], Mackerricher- [18626_1], 12. If offshore boundary was indeterminable using NOAA charts, then DFG DRG charts or aerial imagery (see step 13) were used. California DRG 1:24,000 scale digital charts were used as a reference for boundary mapping for the following individual MPAs: Sonoma Coast SMCA- [CALQUAD: 1099, QUADNAME: Bodega Head, OCODE: o38123c1, TRIM:8] [CALQUAD: 1062, QUADNAME: Duncan Mills, OCODE: o38123d1, TRIM:8] Fort Ross SMCA- [CALQUAD: 1026, QUADNAME: Fort Ross, OCODE: o38123e2, TRIM:8] [CALQUAD: 1025, QUADNAME: Plantation, OCODE: o38123e3, TRIM:8] Hopkins SMR- [CALQUAD: 1686, QUADNAME: Monterey, OCODE: o36121e8, TRIM:27] Agua Hedionda Lagoon SMR- [CALQUAD: 2947, QUADNAME: San Luis Rey, OCODE: o33117b3, TRIM:66] 13. Digitized inshore boundary at 1: 5,000 scale using the Coastal Commissions aerial imagery (NAD83) and/or downloadable imagery server GlobeXplorer (which hosts imagery from other sources: Airphoto USA, i-cubed, etc). The following aerial imagery was used as a reference boundary for the following individual MPA areas: Fort Ross- [fortross_sw.img] Manchester- [Geographic Data Technology, 1998-09-11, 1.0m resolution, 1:12,000 spatial accuracy, panchromatic] Del Mar-[GlobeXplorer, 2001-06-17, 0.1524m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Gerstle Cove- [GlobeXplorer, 2001-06-17, 0.154 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] San Dieguito - [Airphoto USA, 2003-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Corte Madera- [Airphoto USA, 2002-08-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Marin Islands- [Airphoto USA, 2002-08-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Robert W. Crown- [GlobeXplorer, 2000-06-25, 0.1524 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Redwood Shores and Bair Island-[i-cubed, 1999-10-05, 15.0 m resolution, 1:100,000 spatial accuracy, color] Goleta Slough- [Airphoto USA, 2000-05-01, 1.0 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Bolsa Chica- [Airphoto USA, 2004-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color, scale used: 1:20,000, 1:2,500, 1:500] Elkhorn Slough- [Airphoto USA, 2002-08-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Big Sycamore- [Airphoto USA, 2003-09-01, 0.3048 m resolution, 1:2000 spatial accuracy, color] Doheny SMCA/SMP- [Airphoto USA, 2004-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Upper Newport Bay- [Airphoto USA, 2004-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] San Elijo Lagoon- [Airphoto USA, 2003-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] Buena Vista- [Airphoto USA, 2003-04-01, 0.6096 m resolution, 1:0 spatial accuracy, color] 14. Shoreline length was calculated using ET Geowizards. Shoreline in nautical miles. Converted MPA polygon layer into polyline layer. Split polyline into segments. Method used was selecting at all vertices. Each MPA was selected out that intersected with the shoreline layer "county24k". This layer was used as a proxy to get all shoreline portions only; therefore, offshore boundary lines excluded. Summarized all shoreline segments by MPA ID using Geowizards merge function, then summarize by ID. Total length of MPA that touches shoreline represented in field "Length_nmi". [Note- All offshore rocks excluded from selection. All shoreline of islands included. Estuarine MPAs value for length do not include the mouth of the estuary (if mouth occurs). All MPAs that do not touch land show value of zero for shoreline length. MPAs on islands includes shoreline of land for each island. (Farallon MPA includes: Maintop Is, Is of St. James, Southeast Is, and North Island only.) ] 15. Area calculated in square nautical miles. Field "Area_nmi" depicts area calculated for each MPA. Area calculated using X tools Pro, calculate area, nautical miles selected as unit of measure. 16. Perimeter calculated in nautical miles. Field "Perimeter_" depicts calculated perimeter of each MPA. Perimeter calculated using X tools Pro, calculate perimeter, nautical miles selected as unit of measure.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: MPA name as referenced in Title 14, California Code of Regulations, Section 632(b) as of December, 2005.

attrdomv.udom: Whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Classification of designated managed area as established in Public Resources Code, Section 36700. Updated December 2005, adopted Fish and Game Commission changes August 19,2005 CCR, Title 14, Section 632 amendments.

attrdomv.udom: Whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of shoreline of MPA in nautical miles.
Total area in square nautical miles.
Perimeter of MPA in nautical miles.
California Code of Regulations, Title 14, Section

overview.eaover: Attributes give specific information on each of the marine protected areas that have associated DFG fishing regulations for 2005. Information includes: the current names of the existing MPAs and current MPA designation.

cntorgp.cntorg: Department of Fish and Game, Marine Region

cntinfo.cntinst: To request a copy of this dataset, please contact mr_gis@dfg.ca.gov

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420
